thread.title: Watch: 'Sound guy' Greg Maddux throws Kris Bryant a curveball
thread.title_full: Watch: 'Sound guy' Greg Maddux throws Kris Bryant a curveball

author: Bob Hille
title: Watch: 'Sound guy' Greg Maddux throws Kris Bryant a curveball
text:
Watch: 'Sound guy' Greg Maddux throws Kris Bryant a curveball Sporting News 7 hrs ago Bob Hille © (Robert Snow/Red Bull Content Pool) Greg Maddux, left, and Kris Bryant This one could go into the Prankster Hall of Fame.
Former Cubs and Braves star Greg Maddux,known during a Hall of Fame career as “Mad Dog," added a new nickname to his resume — “Sound Guy” — as he got fellow Cubs star and Vegas nativeKris Bryant in an offseason batting practice prank.
MORE: Arizona Wildcats baseball channels 'Major League' in spot-on video spoof
Bryant,under the impression he was doing a baseball workout video beforeleaving for spring training, instead first was bemused by the Red Bull video crew's "Sound Guy" who offered "pine tar … hand sanitizer?" and eventually stepped in as a replacement BP pitcher who had Bryant laughing —"He's pretty good" — not to mention off-stride with an assortment of curveballs.
Only after the "Sound Guy" asked for an autographed bat was Bryant clued in that the dude with the boom mic, long hair, mustache and goatee was, yes, Maddux, a.k.a. "The Professor," and Bryant had been schooled.
 That "Sound Guy" won 355 career games and four Cy Young Awards in his 23-year career.
PHOTOS: 2017 SPRING TRAINING
